column4: Hi, I'd like the keyboard volume keys to control a "softMaster" volume instead the "Master" volume, is there a way to change that?
hm possibly, not certain how to achieve it
are this keyboard volume control like a special hotkey?
yes, I have several buttons such as e-mail, calculator, and two buttons for volume up and down...
mm, laptop?
Nope. It's a wireless logitech keyboard...
ahh nice.. well if it's a really fancy one.. i think it might have specific drivers for extra features, i dont really know what else it can do
if so.. and if the drivers are also for linux.. i would imagine it could be easier
for example my logitech wireless mouse has a CD with software, drivers etc
for ubuntu???
well its linux based.. but even then.. still not likely any support for linux ether
mine doesnt atleast, but your might? if you have any
I don't think so...
mm, well i am pretty sure there should be like.. a document somewhere.. that you should beable to open.. and can probably edit the key of any key
*shrugs* like.. with my logitech mouse i couldnt use my extra buttons.. but there was software out there that enabled me to.. and set whatever value of the keys i wanted
search up your keyboard model.. with ubuntu perhaps

I can use them. They worked out of the box for me. But when I press the volume buttons they change the "master" volume. Which controls only the front speakers. I'd like it to control a "softMaster" which I created and which controls all four channels...

yeah.. well i mean.. thats what btnx did.. allowed me to not only use them.. but use them for whatever i want.. so if you can find something similar.. you can specify it to change the softmaster perhaps?
n2diy: Thanx for the help, I've found the solution: Under system->preference->sound you can change the "default mixer tracks" to control via keyboard...
ahh, great, lucky it was so easy
looks like i underestimated how well thought out ubuntu system is ;)
Yes, and it's even getting better with time (just like wine) ;-)
i look forward to trying wine again soon, as it develops
